radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is markedly distended with numerous gallstones layering within the dependent portion of the fundus. There is a 14 (AP) x 15 (TV) x 14 (SI) mm obstructing stone in the gallbladder neck causing significant distension and mild compression of the extrahepatic biliary tree. There is mild upstream intrahepatic biliary ductal dilation and trace gallbladder wall edema. No other abnormalities in the liver, pancreas, spleen, kidneys, or gastrointestinal tract.
